A psalm written by Asaph for the choir director, to be sung using the tune ‘Lilies of the covenant’
in the Very Holy Place in the temple
the people of the tribes of
Show us that you are powerful
God, cause our nation to be strong like it was before;
be kind to us [IDM] in order that we may be saved
Yahweh, you who are the commander of the armies of heaven,
how long will you be angry with us, your people, when we pray to you?
the only food and drink that you have given us is a cup full of our tears!
You have allowed the people-groups that surround us to fight with
each other to decide which part of our land each of them will take
God, commander of the armies of heaven,
cause our nation to be strong like it was before!
Be kind to us in order that we may be saved!
a grapevine [MET] that you brought out of Egypt;
and you put your people in their land.
clear ground to plant a grapevine [MET],
you cleared out the people who were living in this land for us to live in it
the roots of a grapevine go deep down into the ground and spread [MET],
you enabled our ancestors to prosper and start living in towns all over this land
grapevines cover the hills with their shade
and their branches are taller than big cedar
your people ruled all of Canaan
So why have you abandoned us
someone who tears down the fences
You who are the commander of the armies of heaven, ◄turn to/stop abandoning► us!
Look down from heaven and see
the young vine that you [SYN] planted and caused to grow!
Our enemies have torn down and burned everything in our land;
look at them angrily and get rid of them!
When you do that, we will never turn away from you again;
◄revive us/cause us to be again like we were previously►, and
Yahweh, commander of the armies of heaven, restore us;
be kind to us in order that we may be rescued
